title: What are the best documentaries about the Big Bang? - Quora

response.answer_text: Any documentory that uses the premise that it didn't happen...I'm sorry, I don't believe it happened...too many patches to keep it alive...enough alternatives available.  I know it is still our best guess (look at what's happening now and rewind the tape to see how it started).  If you are still interested in what I'm saying, inflation is what did it in for me.  For it all to work, we needed a very short period of time where everything we've proven to this point is ignored for a key couple of milliseconds...very convienent Same type of argument for intelligent design. I did enjoy Hawkin's summation though...(Paraphrase...no time to look it up) There had to be a "god" to create the universe with all of its wonders...but he did such a good job with the laws of physics and nature, he's got nothing left to due...must be completely bored!

PBS Space Time, on Youtube, has a couple of very good videos on the Big Bang.   They have additional videos on, for instance, Quantum theory, the Cosmic Microwave Background, and a variety of other topics. Some are just too deep for me but I find most very interesting.

The Big Bang theory is complete nonsense. The Universe has always been here. Space has always been infinite - it does not expand. There was no beginning of time. Gravity is created by matter, and only effects other matter, it has no effect on time.

How the Universe Works (2010– ) First Second of the Big Bang If I remember correctly it took the first second after the Big Bang and divided it into time periods of a duration equal to Planck’s constants.
Watch “The Beginning and End of the Universe” on Netflix.
